intro: [WRONG START] S tevia grandidentata var. subeglandulosa, commonly known as the western sweetleaf, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its high concentration of steviol glycosides, which are natural sweeteners used in food and beverages. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Due to its ecological significance and potential commercial value, it is also of interest for conservation and sustainable agriculture.
